overview_of_class:
Internal auditors work within an organization to improve operations, meet regulatory requirements, and manage risk.

Internal auditing is an independent, objective assurance and consulting activity designed to add value and improve an organization's operations. It helps an organization accomplish its objectives by bringing a systematic, disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of risk management, control, and governance processes.
name: Auditing II
title: SCS ACCOUNT 360-DL-15 Auditing II

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Prerequisite: ACCOUNT 350.

This course is conducted completely online. A technology fee will be added to tuition.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
The goals of this course are to:
? Apply the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) internal
? control and Control Objectives for Information and Related Technology (COBIT) methodologies.
? Apply COSO to Section 404(b) of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002.
? Analyze IT environments used to house financial information.
? Apply the appropriate methodologies for auditing revenues and expenses.
? Complete the standard audit report for public entity audits.
? Contrast management's responsibility for reporting on internal control as required by Sarbanes-Oxley and the auditor's responsibilityfor reporting on internal control through integrated audits as required by the PCAOB.
? Summarize the fundamental attributes of internal audit and attestation services.
? Apply the standards for the professional practice of internal auditing.
